column1: Heavy rains in the winter of 1884 left as much as 60 inches (1
column2: 500 mm) washing out the railroad tracks below Temecula as well as along the San Jacinto River and Railroad Canyon near the shore of Lake Elsinore. Flood damage broke the California Southern Railroad financially. The Santa Fe Railroad came to the rescue.  Santa Fe took over the rail line and rebuilt it by the beginning of 1885. The rail line through Wildomar became part of the Atchison

column1: The Wildomar Cemetery District maintains a cemetery in the town. In 2011
column2: the city of Wildomar proposed to take over management of the cemetery district and accomplished the takeover in November of that year.

column1: The Wildomar Library is one of 35 branches in the Riverside County Library System.
The library opened in 2001 and was originally called the Mission Trail Library. In 2014
column2: the County Board of Supervisors voted to change the name to the Wildomar Library.

column1: Interstate 15 bisects the city of Wildomar. Riverside Transit Agency provides local bus service to Wildomar
column2: with Routes 8 and 23 serving the city.

column1: The Riverside County Sheriff's Department's Lake Elsinore Valley Regional Station contracts police services for the city.The city of Wildomar contracts for fire and paramedic services with the Riverside County Fire Department through a cooperative agreement with CAL FIRE.
Public schools in Wildomar are part of the Lake Elsinore Unified School District.

column1: Wildomar has a variety of native plants. Hills are covered with coastal sage scrub and chaparral plant communities
column2: along with the California Poppy. California sycamore grow along riverbeds
column3: providing shade for ferns and mosses.
